hello,what do you mean by your numbers are fine.  What are your typical numbers?  What is your hba1c?As Hba1c rises above 5.0, then the risk of diabetic complications (including neuropathy and muscle damage) starts going up.Non-diabetic numbers, typically fasting is < 95 (ideally in the 80s) and post eating < 120 (ideally close to fasting) would be the best way to reverse what sounds like possible neuropathy.If your numbers are higher then the best approach would be to normalize numbers.  This is best done with low carb diet, and medications as required.Have you seen a podiatrist?   I think you may need to see a specialist to see what the problem really is.   Seems your Dr doesn't know.Do you have fibromyalgia issues in other areas than your feet?  As far as I know fibromyalgia is typically systemic (ie. affects your whole body), not just your feet.Be careful with prednisone.  Steroids can greatly elevate blood sugars, and if your problem is neuropathy will exacerbate it.Anyway, this is an old post.
